sentences.english: I yearn for things that expand the soul and not just the pocket.
sentences.chinese: 我渴望的是充实心灵而不只是涨满口袋。

sentences.english: In spring the brooks would run high with meltwater.
sentences.chinese: 在春天因为融化的雪水很多小溪都涨满了。

sentences.english: The more she saw the blood his cheeks replenish.
sentences.chinese: 涨满他两颊的血液，她看得愈是清晰。

sentences.english: Many houses in the village were carried away when the swollen river suddenly changed its course.
sentences.chinese: 这条涨满水的河突然改道，冲走了村子里好几幢房子。

sentences.english: The ponds were filling up and the frogs were making deep-throated noises.
sentences.chinese: 池塘的水涨满了，青蛙发出低沉的鸣叫声。

sentences.english: The endless rain filled the pools on this autumn night.
sentences.chinese: 巴山的夜里下着绵绵的秋雨，池塘都已经涨满了水。

sentences.english: Several houses in the village were carried away when the swollen river suddenly changed its course.
sentences.chinese: 这条涨满水的河突然改道，冲走了村子里好几幢房子。

sentences.english: The pond is filling up after the heavy rain.
The lake is filling up after this heavy rain.
sentences.chinese: 这场大雨过后湖里涨满了水。

definition: to be full to overflowing/to be brimming over with
congestion/to block/to congest/to crowd/to choke/to cram/to fill up/to stuff/to take up all the space
to roll over and over (of billows or clouds)
to well up/to spill out (of water from a spring)
to well up/to boil out/to bubble forth/to spurt
to ripple/to undulate/also written 蕩漾|荡漾
to gush/to gush out/to pour out
to cascade down/to flow in torrents/(fig.) outpouring (of emotions)
to leak out/to release (liquid or gas)
